payload.body:
This is a long-ish body
with multiple lines.

We should support statuses.
payload.title: Dogfood: tickets status/body

payload.body:
Source: Beads hack-cli-6jo
Status: open

Verify OpenTUI works with bun build --compile and release packaging. Check Zig requirement, bundle size impact, and runtime behavior on macOS/Linux.

Acceptance criteria:
Document compile/build steps and any blockers; confirm whether OpenTUI can ship in release artifacts.
payload.title: [beads:hack-cli-6jo] Validate OpenTUI packaging for hack-cli

payload.body:
Source: Beads hack-cli-i5a
Status: in_progress

Build a minimal hack tui command using OpenTUI: service list panel + aggregate log stream (NDJSON from hack logs --json --follow). Read-only, no actions. Target: run against current project and exit cleanly.

Acceptance criteria:
hack tui renders a basic two-panel UI; logs stream in aggregate; handles Ctrl+C cleanly; uses OpenTUI core only.
payload.title: [beads:hack-cli-i5a] Prototype hack tui with OpenTUI

payload.body:
Source: Beads hack-cli-1q7

Investigate launchctl/brew services approach to run hack global up on boot and document setup.
payload.title: [beads:hack-cli-1q7] Auto-start global infra on login

payload.body:
Source: Beads hack-cli-dg0
Status: open

After the OpenTUI spike, decide whether hack up (no -d) should launch the TUI by default and define flags/env escape hatches.

Acceptance criteria:
Decision recorded in spec/docs with final default and fallback behavior.
payload.title: [beads:hack-cli-dg0] Decide hack up default TUI behavior
